file_content.text: What's going on here? You thought you'd just go and switch sides? Damn you!
I'm sorry, Karrels--it's nothing personal.
It had to be done.
I don't understand. I helped you! I trusted you! We had a bond--and now you murder my men, wave a weapon in my face--
But I guess that doesn't matter much--so let's go. You and me, Blade. The young punk against the old gang leader.
I wish it could've been different. You deserve better.
It's a shame it came to this.
There's another way for this to end. Flee Hutta, and you can live.
You need to go into hiding.
You realize you won't last a minute.
I'm going to win.
Karrels, you can survive this, but we have to work together.
I can help you.
You're offering me mercy? Ha. Your timing's bad; I could use a fight right now.
I just got word that my boys are dead, Blade. Some Imperial piece of filth killed them for refusing to bow and scrape.
You're wrong. One is dead, but the other's only crippled.
They weren't both killed.
How could you know that? How--
I get it. Kill one, take the other hostage--just make sure Karrels Javis cooperates, right? You slime.
What is it you want from me?
I want you to go search for your son and leave your life here behind.
Run, and don't come back.
My son's health in exchange for everything I have, eh? I've made better bargains.
You're going to leave Hutta, Karrels. Take the next flight off-planet and don't come back. You do that, and we'll leave your son alive.
Do what I say or the kid dies.
Damn you. If I'd known what you were, I'd never have let you inside the palace.
I'll go. Not a word to Nem'ro. With what you've done in here, they'll probably think I was disintegrated.
Good luck, Karrels. Be safe.
Take care.
Don't! Don't think you can ruin me and talk like we're buddies.
Wherever you go, I'll be watching you. Now get moving.
I'll know what you do next.
Make one mistake, and your son dies. Remember that.
Don't mess up, or else.
You've made your point. You won't hear from me again.
Goodbye, Blade.
I want you to die.
Not much. [Attack]
Why get yourself killed along with them?
Don't make their mistake.
Because I've spent my whole life proving that I don't roll over for thugs and pirates. And with my boys gone, I can take on a lost cause.
It's been nice knowing you, Blade.
You had your chance--but if you won't listen, I can put you down.
Fine. Then die.
That's the way it is. End of the road, Karrels.
Time to die.
You think you're the first piece of scum who's tried to kill me? I was fighting thugs in Jiguuna's streets when I was half your age... I can handle you.
You'll get the gory details after I report to Nem'ro. Figure you can wait that long?
Looks like I'll have to. But you don't get--
Blade--nice you decided to come by, but I was just telling Karrels I can't stay. I know you understand.
What's your hurry, Kaliyo?
Oh?
Business. Nem'ro gets testy if we don't spend a little time together.
You don't have to go yet. Wouldn't mind having some company.
Can't you stick around?
I do--but maybe I'll find a way to make it up to you.
I didn't come here to talk to you, Kaliyo.
You're not why I'm here.
That's sweet, but don't worry about making Karrels feel wanted. He's got enough gangster kids looking for his favor.
Watch yourself, all right?
That girl's a handful. But she's good at what she does, I'll give her that.
I'll have to take your word for it.
If you say so.
What does she do, exactly? Besides swagger and carry a blaster.
"What she does"?
Officially, she's Nem'ro's chief enforcer. Truth is, most of the troops are terrified of her, so she keeps our people in line more than Fa'athra's.
She's a hot little number too, don't you think?
Cute, too.
I try not to notice--I'd rather keep all my parts attached.
Is she always so irritating? It's got to get under your skin.
How do you stand her?
I think Nem'ro's amused by it. She's been like that since she showed up.
Anyway, I'm glad you're here. Those explosions in the Rust Yards--you wouldn't know anything about that, would you?
I took out Fa'athra's mining operations; I heard they were giving you trouble.
I'll take credit.
Fa'athra's mines won't cause you any more trouble.
Looks like you're lucky.
Heh. I thought you might've had something to do with it. Good work, Blade. Good work. I like a person who takes initiative.
I think it was some sort of explosion. Don't know the details.
There was a blast.
Is that right? Reports say that Fa'athra's mining equipment was destroyed. Half of the shvash gas pocket collapsed! It's good news, Blade--however it happened.
With Fa'athra's mines broke down, we can increase production. Fa'athra'll want revenge, of course, but we'll be ready.
What kind of action is Fa'athra going to take?
What kind of revenge?
We'll have to wait and see, but I'm not too worried.
I'm glad to hear it.
Good.
You should be. You've made friends in the palace, so long as we're in power.
Sounds like I picked the right side in this gang war.
Glad I'm with you.
Did you ever doubt us? Don't answer that--I'd rather not know.
Look, I have something for you. You'll like it--I'll send it to your room. You've done good work for us; you deserve more than credits.
Which reminds me--how long are you staying on Hutta?
Not much longer, if everything goes right.
Just a little while.
What makes you ask?
Why?
I really wish I knew the answer to that.
I'm not sure.
Well, if you're still around in a few weeks, I'd like you to meet my sons. They'll be home from their trading expedition, and I think you'd get along.
Think about it, is all I'm saying. Now get going--I'm sure you have other business to take care of.
I'll definitely think about it. Might lead to something interesting.
I will.
Thanks for everything, Karrels.
I appreciate it.
You've got no idea, believe me.
More than you know.
Take care of yourself, Blade. Things are looking up.
Another time, Blade. Maybe we can get that drink later.
Fa'athra will not stop his mining operations. He's going to keep tapping our gas pocket and cut our supply in half!
And when Fa'athra's customers see he can't refine the gas like we can, they'll return to us. What is the problem, then?
Don't play dumb with me, Toth'lazhen. Fa'athra doesn't need to steal our customers if he doesn't leave us any gas to sell. And we can't uproot him without help--
I will not discuss this in front of an outsider, Karrels! Enough.
Idiot. Sorry about Toth'lazhen, Blade--"legitimate" business brings out the worst in us. Makes me miss actual crime, you know?
But it looks like you're about to brighten my day--you find the shipment?
I have it right here--delivered as promised.
Got it.
If you have my money, then I've got your shipment.
Are you paying?
You sound like my kids.
Next time, you can muck through the swamp yourself.
Barely. What a mess.
Afraid of getting your hands dirty? Heh... sound like my kids.
The fee's been transferred to your account--you'll have access by the time you're back at your apartments. You earned every credit.
I'd buy you a drink in the cantina, but I need to have a chat with Nem'ro. We should talk more another time, though--you do good work.
I appreciate it, Karrels. Good luck with the Hutt.
We should do that.
Right. I'll need it.
Always looking for business. Just say the word, Karrels.
We'll meet again.
I'll be around. No promises, though.
Whatever.
Then I'll see you when I see you.
Come back when you've found my missing shipment, Blade. I don't have time for conversation.
Mm. Blade, come on over--glad to see you're enjoying the palace.
I don't regret coming here yet.
It's working out.
Sure. Nem'ro brings in a good crowd--plenty of opportunities.
Thanks. Not my usual sort of hangout, but it's got its charms.
It's not so bad.
"Enjoying" it? Karrels, this place is a cesspool.
I'm not.
You wanna do business in this town, you learn to like it. I figured that out the hard way.
Look, I've only got five minutes before I have to meet with some alien freaks--the type who can't even speak the language.
But I wanted to ask you--your people, they're subjects of the Empire, right? What's dealing with the Imperials like?
For me? It's been profitable. As for the rest of my people, you'd have to ask them.
Pretty smooth.
That's alright. I'm more interested in your views as an independent operator.
Look, I've only got five minutes before I have to go meet with some alien freaks, and I wanna ask you something:
You've been around the galaxy a few times--what's it like dealing with the Empire?
Mind if I ask why you wanna know?
That's an odd question.
You're a real independent. They don't make criminals like you anymore.
It's been good business, and the government hasn't given me much trouble.
Pretty smooth.
You're one of the last real independents. I admire you for that--but your kind is dying out.
The Empire's a pain to deal with. I stay away from it, these days.
Trouble.
You're lucky to have that luxury. Not many of us do.
The Hutts have taken control of the gangs. And I think real soon, the Republic and Empire will want control of the Hutts--even if Nem'ro won't believe it.
So if we gotta pick a side, I wanna pick a winner... and I don't see the Empire losing.
Sounds reasonable, but what are you going to do about it?
So what's your plan?
For starters, I make sure I'm not being stupid. There's more on the line than business.
Like it or not, the Empire does seem to be the future.
Good call.
I hope so--and not just because of business, either.
The Empire's got plenty of troubles. If you think it's a guaranteed winner, you're fooling yourself.
Wrong.
Maybe I am. I have reasons.
My sons are free traders--they're doing business in the Sullust system. It's their first time dealing with the Empire, so I worry. I probably shouldn't.
But you came to me for a reason. What can I do for you, Blade?
You know Hutta pretty well, but you don't have my skills. I thought we could partner up for a job.
Let's work together.
Is that right? Huh. Normally I wouldn't, but lately I could use someone who works alone and gets results.
Word is that you're on the outs with your boss. Is it true?
I hear Nem'ro isn't your fan.
Look, I need credits, fast, and I'm not picky about what it takes.
Money.
I'm not a charity. Still--I could use someone who can work alone and get results.
Nem'ro's been stewing in his slime since we lost a shipment of rare ores in the Evocii lands. He blames me for some reason.
Now the Evocii--they're Hutta natives, from before the Cartel came. They mostly want us dead. If you'll get that shipment back, I'll pay you good.
You've got a lot more resources than I do. You can't recover the shipment yourself?
You can't handle this?
The Evocii are easy to fight here, on our territory. In the swamps, though, they're a lot sneakier.
All right. I'm interested.
Agreed.
Then maybe we both come out ahead.
How much money are we talking about?
You want to name a number?
More than enough. I'm not negotiating.
There's a work camp outside of Jiguuna. Nem'ro set it up for some Evocii who wanted peace. Bad deal; poor rubes.
The chief there--Odeph--was supposed to talk to the other Evocii tribes about returning the ore, but he didn't come through. He knows something, though.
I'll talk to the chief. We'll get you those ores back.
Got it.
Good. Your payment will be ready when you get here.
Anything I should watch out for?
Will there be dangers?
The Evocii should give you all the trouble you need. They shoot just about anyone who steps on their land.
Just don't lose anything else while I'm gone.
Fine. I'll fix your mess.
Hey--you're the one making money here.
Now if you'll excuse me, I have an appointment to keep. But I look forward to seeing if the Red Blade's as good as they say.
A pleasure to see you, Blade, but I don't have time to chat.
The pirate's on her way. Security droids say she's armed, but she won't be trouble.
Let's hope not. Here she is now.
The pirate's on his way. Security droids say he's armed, but he won't be trouble.
Let's hope not. Here he is now.
I'll go tell the boss.
All right. Come on in but keep your blasters holstered. You who I think you are?
I'm the Red Blade--and I've come a long way to meet with Nem'ro the Hutt.
Let me introduce myself.
I'd heard the rumors. We arranged an appointment.
That depends on who you are, and who you were expecting.
I might be.
I'm Karrels Javis. I'm one of Nem'ro's advisors. Pretty sure I'm expecting you.
You know who I am. Now are we gonna do business, or are you just gonna stand there gawking?
Don't waste my time.
Heh. The Hutt's gonna love this.
This is Karrels. Tell the throne room that the Blade's arrived.
When Nem'ro shows, stay at least five meters back and don't come up unless you're called. One wrong move and you're a pile of ash.
I understand. I'm not here to cause trouble.
Got it.
You worried I'm going to cause trouble?
Scared of me?
Send in Nem'ro and let's do this.
I'm getting impatient.
Just going over the rules. You've got a reputation, and we don't want any problems.
Allow me to present Nem'ro the Hutt--the illustrious crime-king of Jiguuna.
So, the Red Blade finally comes to visit the house of Nem'ro. Great honor comes to the both of us.
I did not expect you to be so soft, however. Very few pirates possess charms like yours. Ha!
You are younger than I imagined... but youth is good in a business partner. Ha!
Now, let us see if the legends of the mighty Blade's generosity are true. What have you brought me and my clan?
Trinkets, great Nem'ro. Nothing more.
Humble gifts.
I do not care about trinkets, little pirate.
Vast treasures, plundered from worlds in every sector in the galaxy--all for you, great Nem'ro.
Great riches.
You talk big, little pirate, but your boasts do not interest me.
It's more than you're worth, you pile of slime.
Better than you deserve.
Maybe you want to repeat that, little Blade?
Not bad. Nem'ro--the idols here are real aurodium. The cloth looks like--
I see, Karrels, I see. Mmm.
You are an impressive creature, Blade. You may conduct your dealings on Hutta with my approval.
Now, experience the luxuries of my palace. Enjoy my slaves, and wallow in opulence!
I'm very grateful; you've got quite a place, here.
Thank you.
Good, very good!
We have business to discuss.
I'm not here for fun.
So serious, pirate! You should sample the pleasures you've been offered. Isn't that right, Karrels?
You couldn't pay me to touch your slaves.
That's disgusting.
You might be surprised, pirate--everyone has a price. Except my loyal lieutenants--isn't that right, Karrels?
Of course, mighty Nem'ro.
Let me introduce my advisors. You have met Karrels Javis; any business you have, you may discuss with him. And this is Toth'lazhen--
Nem'ro, we have little time for guests right now. Security reports that Fa'athra and his clan have struck at our shipments again.
Again? Fa'athra attacks me again? This is outrageous!
Is there a problem, mighty Nem'ro?
Something wrong?
Who's Fa'athra? What does he have to do with anything?
Fa'athra?
Seems I interrupted something. Maybe I should be on my way.
I should go.
Jiguuna is mine! Hutta is mine! Fa'athra knows he defies the laws of the Cartel! I will destroy everything Fa'athra treasures, and--
Looks like your audience with Nem'ro is over. You'll have to forgive the interruption.
I've been working for that Hutt since he killed my gang when I was thirteen. Trust me--you can't talk to him when he's like this.
What's all this about "Fa'athra"?
What's happening?
Seems like your boss has some temper. Why stay with him?
But you stick around?
Because Nem'ro's got power and smarts, along with his temper. I like things a little more orderly than he does, but I don't complain.
I think I can get his attention.
You're underestimating me.
Maybe--but it wouldn't be smart to try.
We're having trouble with the Fa'athra clan, and it's getting to all of us. Fa'athra's out of line, but the Hutt Cartel hasn't bothered to interfere.
So it's a business dispute. What are you feuding over?
Explain.
Everything--the mines, the factories, the slaving operations....
I'm not sure I understand. Why would the Hutt Cartel be involved?
Hutt Cartel?
According to Cartel rules, Nem'ro and Fa'athra are supposed to stick to their territories. Fa'athra's decided Cartel rules don't apply.
That's a real shame. Must make life difficult for you.
Too bad.
You're not kidding. The attacks are bad enough, but Nem'ro's temper could turn a crisis into a bloodbath.
Now, look--I need to work up new plans with security and keep an eye on Toth'lazhen to keep him from suggesting anything stupid.
In the meantime, you're a guest, and you've got our permission to do business here. You've got the run of the palace. So I'll see you around.
Yeah. You probably will.
Right.
Heh. Be careful out there, Blade.
If you need me, I'll be in the cantina.
Check for me in town.
Enjoy yourself, and watch your back--the Poison Pit's a nasty place.
I wouldn't be so sure about that.
You think so?
Right, Blade. Right.
What? Sorry, but I don't have time for visitors right now. Come back another time.
Bah!
